idata.python:
from notes import *
# Create opening melody
def intro_melody():
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=1)
    rest(0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F4, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(F4, beats= 0.25)
# repeat opening melody 8 times and pan from ear to ear    
for i in range(4):
    with pan(value=[-1.0,1.0,-1.0], beats=8):
        intro_melody()
# I was initially going to loop intro as chorus but realised there were differences between notes
rest(300)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Creating base notes
from notes import*
# Have a slight decrescendo to mezzo piano by decreasing gain from 100% to 75%
with gain(value=[1,0.75], beats=4):
    playNote([D3, G2], beats=4, velocity=100)
playNote([D3,F2], beats=4, velocity=75)
playNote([E3,C3], beats=4, velocity=75)
playNote([Eb2,Bb2], beats=4, velocity=75)
# moveTo function to take playhead back to beat 14 and play a note of a different duration at the same time
moveTo(14)
playNote(F3, beats=2, velocity=75)
# crescendo back to full volume (100%)
with gain(value=[0.75,1], beats=8):
    playNote([D3,G2], beats=4)
    moveTo(16)
    playNote(G3, beats=2)
    moveTo(18)
    playNote(G3, beats=2)
    playNote([D3,A3,G3], beats=4, velocity=100)
    moveTo(20)
    playNote(F2, beats=2)
    moveTo(22)
    playNote(Bb2, beats=2)
# volume at 100% play as written in score
playNote([Bb3,E3,C3], beats=4)
moveTo(24)
playNote(G3, beats=2)
moveTo(26)
playNote(G3, beats=2)
playNote([C4,Bb3,G3,Eb3], beats=4)
moveTo(28)
playNote(F2, beats=3)
moveTo(30)
playNote(D4, beats=2)
moveTo(31)
playNote(Fs2, beats=1)
rest(300)

from notes import *
# define in order to loop verse melody for second verse
def verse_melody1():
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    rest(1)
    rest(0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats =0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    rest(1)
    rest(0.25)

    playNote(A4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A4, beats=0.75)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.75)
    playNote(A4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F4, beats=0.75)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(B4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(B4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)

# bring in 'vocals'
rest(31.25)

# play verse melody part 1, once
for i in range(1):
    verse_melody1()
rest(98)

playNote(F4, beats=0.25)
for i in range(1):
    verse_melody1()
rest(200)

idata.python:
# altered from Random Trap Beat Tutorial
hat=4
# repeat until beat 62
for i in range(0, 124):
    # generate a random number between 0 and 10 (inclusive).
    if randint(0, 10) > 2:
        # if the number is greater than 2, play a 1/2 beat hat
        playNote(hat, beats=0.5)
    else:
        # else, play a 2x 1/4 beat notes for a stutter
        playNote(hat, beats=0.25)
        playNote(hat, beats=0.25)
rest(33)

idata.python:
from notes import *
# define prechorus to repeat later
def prechorus():
    playNote(F5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5, sustain=1)
    playNote(G5, beats=3, sustain=0.25)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=1)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Eb5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5, sustain=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5, sustain=0.75)
    rest(1)

    playNote(D5, beats=1)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Eb5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.75, sustain=0.75)
    rest(1)

    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Db5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G4, beats=0.5, sustain=0.5)
    rest(1)

    playNote(F5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(A5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.75, sustain=1)
    rest(1)

    playNote(F5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D5, beats=1)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Eb5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=1.25)
    rest(0.5)

    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Bb4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(Eb5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=1.25)
    rest(0.75)

    playNote(G4, beats=0.25)
    playNote(C5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(Db5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(D5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(Fs5, beats=1)

# bring in prechorus 
rest(63)
# play rechorus once
for i in range (1):
    prechorus()
    
rest(79.25)
for i in range (1):
    prechorus()

rest(100)

idata.python:
from notes import*
# alternating between trebel, alto and bass accompanying notes
rest(32)
def verse_chords():
    for i in range(4):
        playNote([G3,D3,G2], beats=1, velocity=50)
        playNote([G4,D4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    for i in range(2):
        playNote([G3,E3,C3], beats=1, velocity=50)
        playNote([G4,E4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,Eb2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G4, Eb4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,Eb3,Eb2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    # mild crescendo on this single chord
    with gain(value=[0.5,0.60], beats=1):
        playNote([G4,Eb4,A3,F3,F2], beats=1)
    for i in range(2):
        playNote([G3,D3,G2], beats=1, velocity=50)
        playNote([G4,D4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,D3,F2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G4,D4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,D3,F2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G4,D4,Bb2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    for i in range(2):
        playNote([G3,E3,C3], beats=1, velocity=50)
        playNote([G4,E4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,Eb3,Eb2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G4,Eb4], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([G3,Eb3,Eb2], beats=1, velocity=50)
    playNote([A3,D4,D3,F3], beats=1, velocity=50)
    # small crescendo again to a slightly higher volume (65%)
    with gain(value=[0.5,0.65], beats=4):
        playNote([Eb4,Bb4,G3,Eb3], beats=4)
    # still use gain function but change beat duration as using velocity function disrupts volume consistency
    with gain(value=[0.65], beats=4):
        playNote([G3,C3], beats=4)
        moveTo(68)
        playNote([F4,D4,Bb3], beats=1.5)
        moveTo(69.5)
        playNote([Eb4,D4,C4,C3], beats=2.5)
        playNote([D3,G3,G2], beats=4)
        moveTo(72)
        playNote(D4, beats=2)
        moveTo(74)
        playNote(Bb3, beats=2)
    with gain(value=[0.65], beats=2):
        playNote([A4,F3,F2], beats=2)
        moveTo(76)
        playNote(A3, beats=1)
        moveTo(77)
        playNote(Bb3, beats=1)
        playNote([C4,F2], beats=1)
        playNote([D4,Bb4,F3,Bb2], beats=1)
        playNote([Eb4,D3,G3], beats=4)
        moveTo(80)
        playNote(Eb3, beats=2)
        moveTo(82)
        playNote(F3, beats=1)
        moveTo(83)
        playNote(G3, beats=1)
        playNote([G3,C3], beats=4)
        moveTo(84)
        playNote([F4,D4,Bb3], beats=1.5)
        playNote([Eb4,C4,G3,C3], beats=2.5)
    with gain(value=[0.65], beats=4):
    #playNote([D4,G3,B2,E2], beats=3) - commented out (not necessary)
        playNote([B2,E2], beats=4)
        moveTo(89)
        playNote([D4,G3], beats=3)
        moveTo(90)
        playNote(B3, beats=2)
        playNote(Bb3, beats=4)
        moveTo(92)
        playNote([D4,Bb3,Eb3,Bb2,Eb2], beats=2)
        playNote([Eb4,C4,F4,C3,F2], beats=2)
    
for i in range(1):
    verse_chords()
    
rest(16)

idata.python:
# from Beat Machine library in TunePad Loops library
# create a trap percussison beat to play throught the song
from Beat_Machine import *
# define snare, clap and longhat
snare = 2
clap = 10
longhat = 5
beatMachine(snare,   '----*----*--*-------*-------*---')
beatMachine(clap,    '----*-------*--------*-------*--')
beatMachine(openhat, '-------*--------*-------------*-')

# Define beatMachine
def beatMachine(sound, pattern):
    # moves to the beginning of the song (0)
    moveTo(0)  

    # repeat for every letter in the pattern
    for x in pattern:
        if x == '-':
            # if the letter is a dash (-) character rest for a quaver (0.5)
            rest(0.5)
        else:
            # otherwise play the sound for a quaver ('*' will indicate when each drum is played)
            playNote(sound, beats=0.5)
from Beat_Machine import *

kicks = [0, 1]  # a list of two kick sounds that get played together, played on the '*'
beatMachine(kicks, '*---------*-----*---------*--*--')
from Beat_Machine import *

snare = 2
clap = 10
openhat = 5
beatMachine(snare,   '----*----*--*-------*-------*---')
beatMachine(clap,    '----*-------*--------*-------*--')
beatMachine(openhat, '-------*--------*-------------*-')

idata.python:
from notes import*
# add a baseline for prechorus using altered code from Example Project: House Beats in Tunepad's community tab
def bass_line():
    playNote(Eb1, beats=4, sustain=0.25)
    playNote(C1, beats=4, sustain=0.25)
    playNote(G0, beats=4)
    playNote(A0, beats=3)
    # pitch B flat down one semitone using bend function and slide back to og note
    with bend(cents = [ 0, -100 ], beats=1):
        playNote(Bb0, beats=1)
        
# play baseline during prechorus and loop for duration of prechorus (8 bars)
rest(64)
for i in range(2):
    bass_line()
    
rest(80)
for i in range(2):
    bass_line()

idata.python:
from notes import*
# melody to be looped for the second verse so must be defined as a block of code
rest(96)
def full_chorus():
    #define the recurring parts of the chorus (the runs)
    def Chorus():
        playNote(Bb5, beats=0.25)
        playNote(C6, beats=0.25)
        playNote(D6, beats=0.25)
        playNote(C6, beats=0.5)
        playNote(Bb5, beats=0.25)
        playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    def Chorus_2():
        playNote(Bb5, beats=0.25)
        playNote(C6, beats=0.25)
        playNote(D6, beats=0.25)
        playNote(C6, beats=0.5)
        playNote(Bb5, beats=0.25)
        playNote(G5, beats=0.25)
        playNote(F5, beats= 0.25)  
    #create chorus using defined terms with notes that are not repeated
    #put defined terms and unrepeated notes into a new def function to create full code block to repeat for second verse 
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    rest(0.5)
    for i in range(1):
        Chorus()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    rest(0.5)
    for i in range(1):
            Chorus_2()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(F5, beats=1)
    for i in range(1):
                Chorus()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    rest(0.75)
    playNote(F5, beats=0.75)
    playNote(Fs5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    rest(0.5)
    for i in range(1):
        Chorus()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.25)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.25)
    for i in range(1):
        Chorus_2()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    for i in range(1):
        Chorus()
    playNote(Bb5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    
for i in range(1):
    full_chorus()

rest(82)
for i in range(1):
    full_chorus()
rest(10)

# interlude between chorus 1 and second verse
from notes import*
rest(120)
# transpose 2 ocatves down (24 steps) and crescendo to mezzo piano
with transpose(-24), gain(value=[0,0.75], beats=2):
    playNote([C4,D3,E3,C3], beats=4)
# lower volume using gain and transpose 2 octaves (24 steps) down
with transpose(-24), gain(value=[0.75], beats=25):
    with gain(value=[0.75], beats=1):
        playNote([Eb4,G4,Ab2,Eb3,D3], beats=2)
        moveTo(124)
        playNote(Bb4, beats=3)
        moveTo(125)
        playNote([Eb4,Ab4], beats=1)
        moveTo(126)

        moveTo(126)
        playNote(C3, beats=2)
        moveTo(127)
        playNote([C4,F4,Eb4,D3,F2], beats=1)
    # small crescendo
    with gain(value=[0.5,1], beats=3):
        playNote([D4,D3], beats=6)
        moveTo(128)
        playNote([C3,A3], beats=4)
        moveTo(128)
        playNote(G2, beats=3)
    moveTo(131)
    playNote(A2, beats=1)
    moveTo(132)
    playNote(C3, beats=2)
    moveTo(132)
    playNote(Bb2, beats=3)
    moveTo(134)
    playNote([F4,F3], beats=2)
    moveTo(134)
    playNote(C3, beats=1)
    moveTo(135)
    playNote([C3,D3], beats=1)
    playNote([E4,D3,E3,C3], beats=4)
    moveTo(136)
    playNote(E4, beats=2)
    moveTo(138)
    playNote(G4, beats=2)
    playNote([G4,Bb4,G4], beats=2)
    # small decrescendo
    moveTo(140)
    playNote([D3,Eb3], beats=5)
    moveTo(140)
    playNote([Eb4,Ab2], beats=3)
    moveTo(142)
    playNote(F4, beats=2)

    moveTo(143)
    playNote([E4,C4,F2], beats=2)
